After over 600 hours of being a killer main I see 60% percent of this game is trying to get perks addons and killers once you have your perfect setup a survivor perk or play just destroys it this game is just constant unbalancing and balancing for money, for example boil over was extremely op for like a few weeks, that brings tons of survivors back to playing dbd then nerf boil over to bring the killers back it's just a cycle Dead By Daylight is an amazing game just dont buy a brand new killer or grind for a new perk until you are sure it wont be nerfed

This game is fun, and addictive, but beware the online community. Games with trolls and/or other angry, toxic players are sadly common, but so to are games with good people showing good sportsmanship. Have fun, but keep a thick skin too.

É um ótimo jogo, é de certa forma divertido - se não fosse pelo medo e a super palpitação que dá no coração ao jogá-lo. HAHAHA
O game é fácil de entender as mecânicas de como jogar, o que fazer e o que não fazer.
Tanto jogando como Killer ou como Survivor. 
O que leva um tempo é você compreender os Perk's que o jogo te dá, porque são MUITOS e cada personagem tem vários específicos que só o próprio possui.
Posso dizer que tenho apenas umas 7 horas de game, mas já tenho um panorama que não sei se é proveniente do meu Rank (que atualmente está 19 - de um máximo de 20, sendo 20 o "menor/pior" rank) mas há uma boa parcela de "Quitters" (jogadores que saem no meio da partida porque foram pegos pelo Killer).

Meu computador não é dos mais incríveis em quesito de placa de vídeo, mas jogando com resolução no mínimo - e gráficos também - ele rodou tranquilamente (liso) na minha GTX 745 TI.

Recomendo o jogo, ainda mais se for jogar com amigos, e com ajuda de alguma comunicação de voz, qualquer que ela seja. O jogo poderia implementar algum tipo de comunicação in-game por voz, mas não sei se a imersão que ele proporciona sem a chance de comunicar-se com os parceiros desconhecidos seria a mesma.

Até então não tive oportunidade de jogar com amigos/pessoas com algum canal de voz, mas retirando isso, o game é bom demais, e viciante!

Honestly, this game has a terrible ranking system, one of the worst I've ever encountered. Matchmaking doesn't work properly most of the time. So many bugs are in this game and with every update, comes more... Most maps are poorly designed and Survivor/Killer sided. Certain perks for both sides are unbalanced... Certain Add-ons for Killers are unbalanced. Various killers are weak, so weak that it'll be better if you hook gens and do survivors. The hit detection system has never been fully fixed. With all this said, the worst thing is that the Dedicated servers ruin most of the games you play.

Though I'm terrified every single time I play Survivor, I'd recommend the game. 
There’s never been a better time to face your fears / anxiety than running from someone trying to kill you.
It can be a bit too repetitive but lets be honest guys,  you'll keep coming back for new thrills and terrors. It's addictive, SO I'd recommend the game even when you play against a toxic Killer who acts as if they are going to let you escape only to murk you via Mori OR  when you're playing the Killer the Survivor is just as toxic with flashlights. All in all, it's a great game. <3

One of those games I wish there was a "meh" button for. I think most people who think they'd like this game would get their money's worth. It'll take probably about 800 hours until you start feeling like you're good at the game. 

Unfortunately I feel like the current balance of the game is "whoever tries harder wins", and often it's just an alternating pub stomp of one side trying hard and one side setting up some elaborate play for a meme. Too many perks of varying utility to justify most of them. Many should probably be combined but can't because that'd be a ton of work. Honestly I'd like to see them experiment with letting killers and survivors have like 8 perks each at this point. Give survivors in-game communication and balance the game around SWF.

But instead it'll probably just be a new licensed killer with no new map.
